title: The Record Route Option is an Option!
description: The IPv4 Record Route (RR) Option instructs routers to record their IP addresses in a packet. RR is subject to a nine hop limit and, traditionally, inconsistent support from routers. Recent changes in interdomain connectivity—the so-called "flattening Internet"—and new best practices for how routers should handle RR packets suggest that now is a good time to reassess the potential of the RR Option.
authors: B. Goodchild, Y. Chiu, H. Lu, R. Hansen, M. Calder, D. Choffnes, W. Lloyd, M. Luckie, E. Katz-Bassett.
